name: Update3

values.name: eval
values.comment:
Allows the output of an update function that returns type:

    (model, Cmd msg, outmsg)

To have its model and out message evaluated in order to produce a new model,
and to create more commands. The commands returned will be appended to those
passed in using Cmd.batch.
values.type: (outmsg -> model -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg )) -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg, outmsg ) -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg )

values.name: evalCmds
values.comment:
Allows the output of an update function that returns type:

       (model, Cmd msg, Cmd outmsg)

To have its model and out message evaluated in order to produce a new model,
and to create more commands. The commands returned will be appended to those
passed in using Cmd.batch.

Note that the eval function in this case is not provided with the model, since the
commands being processed are opaque, so it should not be possible to make a decision
on how to update the model based on them.
values.type: (outmsg -> msg) -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg, Platform.Cmd.Cmd outmsg ) -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg )

values.name: evalMaybe
values.comment:
Allows the output of an update function that returns type:

    (model, Cmd msg, outmsg)

To have its model and out message evaluated in order to produce a new model,
and to create more commands. The commands returned will be appended to those
passed in using Cmd.batch.
values.type: (outMsg -> model -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg )) -> Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg, Maybe.Maybe outMsg ) -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg )

values.name: evalResult
values.comment:
Allows the output of an update function that returns type:

       (model, Cmd msg, Maybe outmsg)

To have its model and out message evaluated in order to produce a new model,
and to create more commands. The commands returned will be appended to those
passed in using Cmd.batch.
values.type: (outMsg -> model -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg )) -> (error -> Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg) -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg, Result.Result error outMsg ) -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg )

values.name: lift
values.comment:
Lifts an update function of type:

    update : submsg -> submodel -> ( submodel, Cmd submsg, outmsg )

Into one that returns:

    (model, Cmd  msg, outmsg)
values.type: (model -> submodel) -> (submodel -> model -> model) -> (submsg -> msg) -> (submsg -> submodel -> ( submodel, Platform.Cmd.Cmd submsg, outmsg )) -> submsg -> model -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg, outmsg )

values.name: mapCmd
values.type: (msga -> msgb) -> ( a, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msga, c ) -> ( a, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msgb, c )

values.name: mapModel
values.type: (model -> a) -> ( model, b, c ) -> ( a, b, c )

values.name: mapOutMsg
values.type: (outMsg -> c) -> ( a, b, outMsg ) -> ( a, b, c )

name: Task.Extra
comment:
Extra helper functions for working with Tasks.

@docs message

values.name: message
values.comment:
A command to pass a message to the Elm router and evaluate it in the next
update cycle.

name: Update2

values.name: eval
values.comment:
Allows the output of an update function that returns type:

    (model, Cmd msg)

To have its model evaluated in order to produce a new model, and to create more
commands. The commands returned will be appended to those passed in using
Cmd.batch.

Note that this allows multiple invokations of the same update function to be
invoked recursively. Beware of causing infinite loops while doing this.
values.type: (model -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg )) -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg ) -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg )

values.name: lift
values.comment:
Lifts an update function of type:

    update : submsg -> submodel -> ( submodel, Cmd submsg )

Into one that returns:

    (model, Cmd  msg)
values.type: (model -> submodel) -> (submodel -> model -> model) -> (submsg -> msg) -> (submsg -> submodel -> ( submodel, Platform.Cmd.Cmd submsg )) -> submsg -> model -> ( model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd msg )
